page.title: 04HOUGHTON HALL ART COLLECTION
page.content: Robert Walpole was a connoisseur who collected examples of various forms of art.Pictures by RUBENS, VAN DYCK, TITIAN, REMBRANDT ect. hung on the walls. In the Stone Hall and in the Picture Gallery are still to be seen antique busts acquired by Robert Walpole when the house was first built.The bronze LAOCOON, from the workshop of GIRARDON who did many sculptures for Louis 14th., still stands in the Stone Hall.Robert Walpole's grandson George third Earl of Orford, was responsible for the removal of many of the pictures. He was an eccentric and had periods of insanity when he sold many of the pictures,some to other collectors and 12O to CATHERINE THE GREAT of Russia when she was setting up the HERMITAGE MUSEUM.
